Reviews.Title: “hot hot shower”
Reviews.Author: bigmomma615
Reviews.Content: Ever time i come to Phoneix,AZ . I all ways stay here . They are very nices to me every time i come to this hotel . the Front staff accommodating was EXCELLENT . Im a smoker and my room didnt smell like a smokers room and i like that very much . and the shower was very hot water, i love that . Internet in room was very strong signal . i stayed on facebook for hours..

Reviews.Title: “Good value at $90”
Reviews.Author: travelismypassion
Reviews.Content: Front staff accommodating. Asked for extra pillows and they were provided no problem. Room newly renovated. Flat screen tv and all the amenities listed on their website. Internet in room132 very weak signal or none. Picked us up at airport after we dropped our rental car and will take us at 5 am to catch flight. Start complimentary breakfast at 5am. Was told they could not take us anywhere for dinner but suggested we go across street to Hyatt. Good advice; they have nice lobby and great salmon salad.

Reviews.Title: “Chase Field”
Reviews.Author: Courtney S
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for their shuttle to "local destinations" as mentioned on their website. Chase Field is mentioned TWICE around their "local destinations" comment. i even called to verify they would go there and was told the prices for round trip!!! well, of course, once we were in Phoenix, and called the front desk for our ride to Chase Field, we were told that there was only a "skeleton crew" on duty and they couldn't send their driver to Chase Field cause they needed them for the airport. now bear in mind, this is a Saturday at 11am, a "skeleton crew"?? when's the whole crew there, Tuesday nights at 1am?? the only reason we stayed at this hotel was for this service. we would have stayed somewhere else, or even rented a car had we known this would've happened. this alone would make me not recommend this hotel to anybody!! false advertising on their website, but then to even call and talk to a human and have them tell me the prices only to get there and have them say, "no, we need to go to the airport", it's unacceptable. not to mention the couch pillows that they have on their beds. DON'T RECOMMEND!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good sleep at Sleep Inn”
Reviews.Author: chuck29355
Reviews.Content: I slept good, parking area felt clean and safe, check in was friendly carpets modern and furnishings nice and seemed new. Now for my grips, none very serious. Main grip was shower, head was to my neck (short), very short and water pressure very bad, took about 2 min to get hot water so while you wait cold water is splashing on you. might be smart to turn on water, use stool, then when done will be warm. Also room is very small, there are a few a bit bigger but most are tiny. Also lots of airplane noise but was tired and able to sleep well. If traveling alone and goal is sleep good choice, if with more than yourself it will be tough to move about the room. Also breakfast was not terific, yet on par with other freebreakfast places. Mostly annoyed how small breakfast area was. There was about 5 people in breakfast area and it felt shoulder to shoulder, but hey, its free, if you don't like it skip it.Overall better than expected for price paid. I think the Patel family runs this hotel and most hotels run by the Patel family cut lots of corners as do most Choice hotels. This hotel really isn't that bad and didn't cut cost that affect service and would stay here again if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value with easy access to airport”
Reviews.Author: DCM1a
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on the evening of 25th Sept 2011 and at $70 per room found this to be exceptional value. The room was decent sized,clean and we were also able to spend time at the hotel swimming pool. The breakfast was self service with items you could select from a fridge and also juices,tea and coffee were available in unlimited quantities. It was there that I learnt how to use a waffle maker and found them great with syrup on top. All this was included in the room charge. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to spend the night”
Reviews.Author: AZDennis
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel on many occasions. Each stay was for only a single night as it is my favorite hotel to stay in when I make the long drive down to Phoenix for an early morning flight the next morning. I always ask for their special rate that includes 7 days of parking for very additional cost. Overall, this saves me quite a bit over official airport parking or nearby commercial parking. Every time I have been there, the place has been spotless. Yes, the rooms are not huge, but then I am not there to spend a week of vacation. It is furnished very basically but the beds are comfortable, the rooms are quiet and I can count on a good night's sleep before I have to leave for the airport. The shuttle service is very good, but make sure you are in the lobby at least 15 minutes before it is due to leave. One time I had to wait for the shuttle to come back from the airport as it was full and I could not get on at the appointed time. They will also pick you up fairly quickly with just a phone call when you return to the airport after your trip is over. Keep in mind that this is NOT an upscale hotel and they provide just the typical basic services. Breakfast is limited, but that is typical of this type of hotel. If you need a place very close to the airport for a good night's rest AND want to leave your car, this is a great place to do so. Not too many places to eat or shop in the immediate area but plenty of restaurants in nearby Tempe.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night..”
Reviews.Author: sunsetbeachgal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK for our one night stay...room was very, very small as was bathroom. Bed was comfy and halls were quiet making for a good nights sleep before an early flight. Morning breakfast started very early which was a big help, and was very nice. We did not utilize the airport shuttle as we had a rental car. The hotel provided excellent directions to get to the rental car area which is off airport at PHX. Hotel staff was efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is ten minutes from Sky Harbor with free shuttle service and free continental breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: struggles13
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, clean hotel. J. at the front desk was very helpful as was the shuttle driver. I owe them much gratitude for their assistance. The water in the rooms (like everywhere else in Phoenix) is heavily clorinated so I suggest bringing bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Good Buy”
Reviews.Author: JG2429
Reviews.Content: The only nice thing I can say about this hotel is that the room was clean. The room was tiny barely could move around. The tv was only a 19" tube tv for a double bed room. The pillows were so small on the bed you had to call for extra's. Good luck with that, everyone apparently orders more so if you arrive late you won't get any. I have a bad back so I needed the extra pillows to sleep comfortable. If you like to soak in a bath after along day of travel, forget this hotel they don't have tubs only showers. If you just want a cheap place to stay in between flights this hotel may do it for you. But they charge more on any given night.. Friday night was $65,00 and Monday night was $82.00 go figure. Makes no sense to me why they charged more. Breakfast was adequate for a continental. Coffee in the rooms was horrible, it really was undrinkable. Oh and by the way the wireless connection in the hotel is rediculous. No matter what room you are in its only one bar. Goodluck surfing.. I don't think I would waste my $85 on staying here again. It was not worth the money. Never stayed in such a tiny room before.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to sleep close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Woodenshoe
Reviews.Content: After landing on the airport of Phoenix we searched for a place to sleep in a short distance. We found the Sleep Inn Phoenix airport. Overall it was a decent place to sleep. The complimentary breakfast was okay. After 1 night we left for our roundtrip.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute life saver...”
Reviews.Author: AggieGolfer
Reviews.Content: Had a layover in Phoenix due to missing a connecting flight. Jumped on my mobile tripadvisor app and read great reviews so I jumped on it. Called them and they sent a shuttle (free) to pick me up from the airport. Got checked in quickly and was off to my room. The room was really small but still had a "nice" feel to it. Ordered a late night pizza and hit the sack. Slept like a baby and had a early morning wake up call. Hot and cold breakfast was served after 5 a.m. so I got some cereal and waffles! Also had some OJ and coffee :) Man I was stuffed after that and was ready for the shuttle (free) back to the airport. Great stay and very friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good price for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: goaway_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered a good price for an overnight stay before getting on a plane the next morning. It is very close to the airport & the courteous staff offers a free shuttle at any time to and from the airport. Although it mentioned that it was recently remodeled, there were a couple details that showed the place is aging rapidly which is accentuated by the musty smell in the corridors. We tried not to pay too much attention to the many signs in the parking lot reminding us that we the hotel was not responsible for any losses or damage to the vehicles and just parked the car under one of the surveillance cameras. We certainly enjoyed the pool, a generous continental breakfast & the proximity to the main spots in phoenix. Overall a good experience. Will come back when needing a place to rest before a departure from Sky Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location - great price!”
Reviews.Author: BevandBob
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sleep Inn because it's near the Phoenix Sky Harbor airport. With discounts, it was well under $100 and our double room was quiet, spacious, and clean. The staff was very friendly, and the AC plentiful and quiet. We will definitely return to the Sleep Inn next time we are passing through Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: HistoryGal2009
Reviews.Content: Check-in was great. I ended up using wipes to clean the toilet. Pillows were lumpy. Overall the room was nice but the cleanliness really was what pulled our rating down. The hotel is also tricky to find ... 47th Street and 47th Place are quite close to each other. Thankfully, Courtyard Marriott's parking lot connects the two hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service for a business trip and I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: meredit
Reviews.Content: I chose the Sleep Inn for its proximity to the university at which I was attending a five-day class. Upon arrival I was pleasantly surprised to discover that the hotel offered a free daily shuttle to and from my class, as well as to and from the airport, a wonderful perk. The pool and hot tub were clean, the hotel was quiet, and the maid service was great. Thanks for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, high priced, there are better places”
Reviews.Author: CopperMiner
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Sleep Inn many times. They have built their business around airport travelers. Rooms are small and some of the clientele are a little shady, but they were always good at what they did. They used to have my name and my Choice Rewards number in the system and always gave me a discount since I was a regular. The last time, there were different people and they couldn't find my name. Said they had a new system. Only gave me a $5 discount. The next morning a very helpful clerk, Anna was able to find my info and made sure I got my Choice Rewards points. There are other much nicer hotels in the immediate area, including Courtyard and Hilton just across the parking lot. The Hilton costs much more if you book with them but if you reserve a day or two early through Expedia or Priceline the price is less than this Sleep Inn. If you need a place with good shuttle service and can't find anything else, Sleep Inn will do.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peterwill40
Reviews.Content: My stay at Sleep Inn Airport - Phoenix was execellent in all aspect from the time of booking to the time of departure. Front Desk personnels were consistently professional and helpful no matter who was working in front. The staff was very friendly. Great to have been able to park our car free for week while on cruise. The SHuttle to/from the airport and the parking was so convenient. We were able to get a little breakfast at 5am before catching our flight out of Phoenix airport. Hotel offers free WIFI. Only problem was not having a dining facility at the hotel.But Sleep Inn Airport - Phoenix provided a 20% discount coupon for the Hilton down the steert. Good food there- problem solved. Very clean facility everywhere, very good experience. I'll use Sleep Inn Airport - Phoenix again. I would also recommend staying there to everyone. Great Service! Very friendly staff.. I would recommend Sleep Inn Airport by Phoenix Airport to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “If you plan on spending less, read the reviews of other national chains, you'll stay here”
Reviews.Author: Jim-OnTheWayHome
Reviews.Content: Even though I have done over 50 motel reviews in the last six months, I seldom read other reviews prior to staying at a motel. My first two choices tonight in Phoenix were $29 motels, one no longer had an airport shuttle and the other had one bad review out of five but it gave me an uneasy feeling. So I called one of the national chains to make a reservation, but because they did not have food nearby I told them I would eat at the airport first and call back for a shuttle ride. But while I ate, for the first time at an airport restaurant I took out my laptop and looked at Trip Advisor for that motel …. ‘Awful’ … ‘The place should be torn down’ … ‘won’t be coming back’ … ‘Filthy’ … ‘Stay Away’ … ‘If you value your safety – DO NOT STAY HERE.’ Not a single good review in the last year for that motel. So, that is how I ended up at the Sleep Inn … I’ve stayed here before and and I will say it is ‘great’ … ‘new(er)’ … ‘I will be back (2nd time here in 3 months)’ … ‘Clean’ … ‘Do stay’ … ‘quiet industrial area, Hilton across the street-safe area.' … Yes I paid more than $29 … I paid twice that, but you get what you pay for and even for someone who is as cheap as me, it was worth it. (I’m now writing 2nd reviews, to see if my first review was the exception)

Reviews.Title: “Another OK hotel in Tempe”
Reviews.Author: pfafftonian
Reviews.Content: Like many of the hotels in Tempe, this hotel is quite adequate for a week of business travel, but it's not fancy. Desk staff was helpful, cleaning crew was very thorough. Even though my third floor room looked out on the Hohokam Freeway, I never heard any noise. I would have liked more light in the room - it really seemed quite dark, especially at night. I would definitely stay here again. It can be a little hard to find,as another reviewer noted. My advice: Get yourself headed west on University Drive. Pass under the Hohokam Freeway (143). Take the first right which is 47th Place. Sleep Inn is kind of tucked in behind another business on the right.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough - when you find it”
Reviews.Author: The_Sherriff
Reviews.Content: Came in off a long intercontinental flight with the Sherriff's Lady. The map and directions on the internet proved pretty well useless if you were starting out from the car rental centre and we ended up with a long tour round the periphery of the airport and numerous wrong turns before a helpful desk clerk at a Marriott Courtyard gave us some useful directions - straight out the back of his parking lot and across the street... The rooms really are on the compact side - having two suitcases open took up most of the floorspace but it was a comfortable bed and we slept well enough. Breakfast was unexciting but edible, although much improved by the Sherriff's Lady's facility in Spanish, which meant that we could get some reasonably hot water to make tea. Incidentally, don't believe the Yorkshire Tea ads about making a brew that can stand up to Arizona water!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: takeiteasy1
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were very friendly and our room was very clean. A touch dated but clean and comfortable. TV had great channels. So quiet and the bed was like sleeping on air. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A great price in a large city”
Reviews.Author: shaff01
Reviews.Content: This is pretty much the standard Sleep Inn. you normally know what you are getting when you book her-a clean room with basic amenities. This location did not disapoint us and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Low cost in a high cost neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Jim-OnTheWayHome
Reviews.Content: Next door to the Hyatt, Marriott, etc Was stranded in PHX at the airport due to weather, the Sleep Inn with Corp pricing was less than the discount from the airlines. Weather was great, people using pool/hot tub but I did not. No issues with room or service, used free airport shuttle to and from the airport. Interesting shower, no tub. Shower is 'rounded' so there are no corners. Looks and feels like a $100 room. Used a 20% discount coupon from the Sleep Inn to eat next door at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price!”
Reviews.Author: 2seniorcitizens
Reviews.Content: Stayed here upon arriving in Phoenix and then departing. Rooms are on small size but weren't there long enough to care. So nice that windows (we were on second floor) could be opened as I hate air going all night. I also appreciated the electrical outlet right next to bed for using an iPod. So hard to find an exposed plug in rooms nowadays. Breakfast is very basic here but appreciate cereal with the toast/donut. Very convenient shuttle service anytime you need it. Also wi-fi and a computer/printer for public use. All in all a great stay for the rate!

Reviews.Title: “what a lovely place”
Reviews.Author: lawees
Reviews.Content: arrived late off plane . in the airport there are telephones to call direct to your hotel for pick up by minibus . it arrived within 5 mins and we arrived at the hotel were we were greeted warmly, The room was clean and in the morning there was a complimentary continental breakfast great . we were then back on the mini bus taking us back to airport to pick up our rental car.And again a shuttle bus to take us to car rental FANTASTIC!! we could learn a thing or two from these people. If you are arriving in phoenix after 8pm,the price is not much more than the days car rental price you would save leaving the pick up to the next day........Hassle free......

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: MsLisaS
Reviews.Content: This hotel appears to be a little old but clean. We were supposed to have a room with two queens. We tried two sets of keys and then the front desk assumed the battery to the key slot was dead. We were upgraded to a roomy king. Yes, I looked under the sheets at the corner of the mattress for bedbugs! The mattress in our room appeared new and plenty of pillows, although I don't care for that kind of pillow. Way too soft. If you have a sensitive neck and can bring your own pillows, I'd suggest it. The bathroom was clean but it has a sliding door that was in need of either some 409 or a fresh coat of paint. (I tried to clean the smudges, with no success.) I imagine the cleaning ladies do not close the door behind them while cleaning the bathroom, so they can't possibly be cleaning a place where the guests are touching to leave the bathroom. Note to the hotel, should they read this. We did not eat the continental breakfast but peaked into the room. It looked about the same as the rest. All in all clean, good value for the money, convenient to the airport, very friendly staff. (You'll hear the planes a bit but the AC unit drowns most of it out.) I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value !!”
Reviews.Author: nconway3
Reviews.Content: they let you park your car at the hotel if you are going to be gone less then 10 days at no cost, and give you a ride at no cost, the other hotels in the area charge for it. I will stay here again and again when I fly out , it was PERFECT.

Reviews.Title: “great stay near airport”
Reviews.Author: adventurer4262
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night before flying home from Phoenix airport. Room 105 smelled clean & fresh upon entering. Although a bit small, it was spotless, with a comfortable queen bed and extra large stand-up shower. The fridge was a welcome sight after drinking warm water for most of the week. The staff at the desk were friendly and thanks to a reviewer's suggestion, I asked for a dinner coupon to use at the Hilton next door. Dinner there was fine and we saved 20%. The Sleep Inn's continental breakfast was quite adequate with hard boiled eggs, cereal, pastries and "make your own" waffles. Seeing as how we paid a AAA rate of only 58.00 and it took just 5 minutes to drive our rental to the airport, we will stay here again without question . It was a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: wittj155
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sleep Inn at both ends of a tour. We spent an extra day visiting Phoenix, and found the hotel to be an excellent base. The front desk was very helpful, the shuttle (both to the airport and to the light rail) was great, and the room was fine. Very clean. Exceptional shower. Breakfast was the usual Choice hotel variety, well stocked and clean. Not many food options in the neighborhood (for those without a car), but the desk clerk gave us a 20% off coupon for the Hilton, where we got a fine meal in the Rimrock Bar and Grill. The light rail was a plus - easy to use and quick. Overall, this is one of the very best airport hotels we've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “If this is in top 30 then Phoenix has really bad hotels”
Reviews.Author: mikebluesz
Reviews.Content: Due to trip advisor ranking, location and price we chose this hotel for a one night pre travel spot. The front desk attendants were mediocre at best. Not friendly at all to be honest. Airport shuttle drivers were great and very friendly! Shuttle service was good. Our room was quite small and I don't think this hotel offers King size beds. The smell in the room was awful. Very stale smelling with a hint of urine. Parts of the room were clean, other parts were very dirty and OLD. If this hotel remodeled and updated the rooms with new beds, dressers, bathrooms...etc and had their front desk workers become nicer I would stay there again. But until then I can not recommend this hotel and I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet, close to airport, but don't expect much from the pool!”
Reviews.Author: pomsrule
Reviews.Content: We needed a convenient location close the airport to rest our heads before our 5:30 a.m. flight. Didn't have a chance to sample the breakfast as we had left the hotel by 3:00 a.m. The room was exactly what we needed to catch some shut eye before flying out...clean and quiet. Beds and pillows were comfy. Surprised to find a microwave and mini-fridge in the room. Somewhat cramped with four people and all of our luggage but we managed. The only disappointment was the frigid pool. The on-line description and the hotel sign in the elevator state the pool is heated. Our kids are avid swimmers, and not afraid to swim in colder temps but this was even too cold for them to get in. I dipped my toes and it was, quite frankly, like ice water. Not to mention it was very filthy and needed some attending to. My son actually got out the net to clean the hot tub himself since there was debris from nearby trees floating around in it. The hot tub temp was exceptionally hot. If you only need a place to rest near the airport that offers 24 hour shuttle and are not interested in the pool, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: ““Nice, Clean and Comfortable””
Reviews.Author: BrettTexas
Reviews.Content: The Sleep Inn Airport hotel in Phoenix, AZ- is a perfect place to stay when flying out of Phoenix airport. They have their shuttle running 24 hours and also had breakfast starting at 5 AM in the morning which is nice if you have an early flight in the morning. The hotel staff was very accommodating and the location is central to all my needs. Rooms are clean, cozy and comfortable beds, loved their shower. I would recommend the hotel…..

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelfaninpa
Reviews.Content: Affordable, comfortable, nice pool, Internet access, TV's in sitting rooms, nice room accomodations and more. This is a great place to stay! Well placed hotel. Transportation by hotel shuttle to and from the airport, both close by. Able to use fitness facility - a REALLY nice facility - next door at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, awesome price and beds to die for!”
Reviews.Author: bindikins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a one night stopover with our two kids 2 and 4 yrs old. Nice and close to the airport and friendly shuttle service (all hours!) The Front Desk was very friendly and went above and beyond regular duties to help us organise our rental car also. The rooms were clean, shower was large with new fittings and the bed was fantastic. Really VERY comfy. Almost as good as the Hilton! They were also really good when my kids made a mess in the breakfast room! I'd stay here again if I come back.

Reviews.Title: “Another Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: black325
Reviews.Content: We stay here once a year on the night before we fly out of Phoenix. As others have noted, the shuttle service is great. After dinner, we return the rental car, go to the airport and call for the hotel shuttle. The next morning we can relax, have breakfast and take the shuttle back to the airport before our flight. This year we were in a room that was newly renovated. The room even had that "new wood" smell from the furniture. For the price, this hotel can't be beat for a short stay. Although the only restaurant nearby is in the hotel next door, we discovered that there is a great restaurant area not too far down University Drive in Tempe.

Reviews.Title: “They make an effort to make customers feel welcome and comfortable, and take pride in their establishment.”
Reviews.Author: chloeCincinnati
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our one night at Sleep Inn and would stay there again. Staff was especially helpful. Appreciated the discount card for use in the restaurant at the Hilton. Breakfast was nice as were the rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a quick night in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: clkerr1118
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay while awaiting a flight for the next morning. Very clean, quick shuttle since it is so close to the airport, free internet and free breakfast. Can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQMesaAz
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and I have to watch the cost. This hotel was in a good spot, right between Phoenix and Tempe and the price was great. I liked their breakfast and I liked the showers...they had two nozzles so you felt really refreshed. The staff was great and I will be coming bsck.

Reviews.Title: “Near airport”
Reviews.Author: Seetraveler
Reviews.Content: Great location as it's a few minutes away from the airport. The free shuttle is awesome! The shuttle driver is great and very helpful at all times. There are no food spots within walking distance of the hotel, which was a con. Breakfast was continental and good. Rooms are a bit tight for 4 people. The furniture in the room is too big for the room and seems a bit out of place. The room we stayed in was recently renovated, which was great! Great spot if you need to stay 1 night and need to be near the airport w/their 24 hr shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs”
Reviews.Author: AZtraveler503
Reviews.Content: I found what looked like a tick, or bedbug on my pillow the morning of my departure. The desk was kind enough to only charge me 1/2 price for the night. The room also smelled musty and the long dark hairs on the sheets definitely were not mine.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: chrishawk
Reviews.Content: Typical Sleep Inn motel, this one is close to the airport but not to close to be affected by plane traffic, I hired a car and the transfer journey is less than 10 minutes. Motel itself is clean, the rooms are small but adequate for a short stay, i used the outdoor pool which did not seem heated. There is a restuarant in the Hilton hotel about 100 metres away, reasonable choice and price. typical breakfast is supplied by the motel. I would recommend this motel for anyone flying in or out of Sky Harbor who just needs a short stay

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greg126
Reviews.Content: There are other so-called airport hotels that could take lessons from this place. I've never stayed at one so focused on the airport - Breakfast starting at 5am on a weekend - wow, 24 hour shuttle service, business center with printer for advance check-in (although it was a little hard getting time on one of the 2 computers), more than one laundry for wash before packing up for the trip home, responsive staff with good info on the local area - especially valued when passing through briefly in transit and there isn't much in immediately visible in the vicinity. Typical of Sleep Inns rooms are smaller but have all the amenities - internet, refrigerator, microwave. I noticed they also have a park-fly program which I could see being a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Thomas057
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to catch a few hours sleep prior to an early flight home. It was an excellent choice for the price. The rooms were a bit smaller than some but were clean and had all the required amenities. We found the beds to be comfortable and the room was quiet. It is only five minutes from the rental car return at the airport. This is an economy hotel, but I would recommend as a place to stay when flying from Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but will look elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: Sukibot
Reviews.Content: Nothing to write home about but adequate for night before a flight. Place is starting to look tired and rooms are small. They had convenient PC for printing out boarding passes. Hard to find. There doesn't seem to be a street sign for their street, but the next street which is similar in name is well-lit so I would guess everybody must make the same mistake. Next time, I'll look into other cheap airport motels on Tripadvisor. However, if I don't find one, this place is good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good and convenient”
Reviews.Author: BlackpoolBelle
Reviews.Content: We needed one night's stay before flying home to the UK, and booked here on the strength of previous reviews - we were not disappointed. Staff at check-in were friendly and helpful, the room was clean (and large, contrary to other reviews, but maybe because we had a King bed?) There is free iced juice, tea and coffee 24hrs a day in the lobby and complimentary razor/ deodorant/ toothbrush/ toothpaste etc if you forget anything. The pool and spa were clean and nice (we really needed them as it was 106deg F, 41deg C when we arrived!) and internet access was free on 2 computers if you didn't have your own. The air conditioner was a little noisy, but that's a small price to pay to sleep in relative comfort when its baking outside. The bed was fine, with 6 (yes, 6!) pillows and there is a fridge and microwave in each room. The free breakfast next morning had lots of choices, including fruit, cereal (even hot oat-type), a selection of breads 'n spreads and "make-your-own" waffles. There is no restaurant on site, but the Hilton across the road has a restaurant and a bar with sandwich/burger/snack type (very nice) meals. You can even get Scottish beer there - we had a guest beer called Kilt lifter! There is also a Denny's within 5 mins walk. The free shuttle to the airport runs approx every half hour, (takes under 10 mins) but you need to book it when you arrive at the hotel. If you arrive at the airport and need the shuttle TO the hotel, use the courtesy phone in the arrivals hall and they will come and pick you up. For a good-priced, clean hotel close to the airport (but not under the flightpath) you really can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NittanyLee
Reviews.Content: We wanted a reasonable price and a hotel that would shuttle us to the airport early in the morning. The staff here was friendly and mroe than willing to help us with directions. We wanted to turn in our rental car the night before we flew home and this hotel provided us shuttle to the airport (only took about 10 minutes) at 5:30 AM. There are 2 computers for guests and they did not charge us to print our boarding passes (some hotels charge per page). The pool was a good size. We spent 3 hours there! I liked the stand up shower (no tub). Not sure if the beds were uncomfortable or if it was me, I just kept tossing and turning (could be because I knew we had to get up so early). Breakfast is provided from 5-10 AM so we were still able to eat before we left for the airport. Great bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a Few Days”
Reviews.Author: teechur
Reviews.Content: I needed a clean, reasonably-priced place to stay during a business trip. This is it. I stayed in the n/s queen room, which is 'small' as mentioned by others, but has a little microwave & frig (although the frig had a pizza box in it, so the maid doesn't look there each cleanup!). Also has free wi-fi which is very important to me. The A/C is the typical, noisy one by the window, but works well. OK free breakfast (think carbs, fruit, hard-boiled eggs) and free USA Today paper. I went across the street to the Hilton sports bar for 'happy hour' cocktails and free munchies (as mentioned by another poster). It was tasty and there were free munchies, but NO free beer/wine anymore. (No restaurant in my hotel) Staff was very nice. I have no problem staying here again. (A little confusing to find...47th street next to 47th Place.)

Reviews.Title: “Got Good Sleep at the Sleep Inn”
Reviews.Author: vter
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights at this hotel. Our room was clean and average sized. There is a nice pool area. It's location is great - near the airport and Tempe/ASU. Staff was pleasant. Not the greatest hotel to stay for a long period of time if you're planning on exploring the Phoenix area, but if you are just in town for a couple days (and especially if you are using the airport), this hotel would do fine.

Reviews.Title: “OK for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Thad
Reviews.Content: The only reason to stay at this hotel is if you have a flight early the next day or got stranded because of a cancelled flight. Having said that, it was perfectly adequate. They have a free shuttle to the airport available 24 hours a day, a microwave in the room, an ok breakfast spread starting before 5am, internet access, an outdoor pool and the staff was perfectly pleasant. The air conditioner rattled little and it was a little difficult to find the place (there's a 47th Street right next to 47th Place) but the room was clean enough and they got us to the airport on time. This is the low end of the Choice chain, so don't expect it to really be a three-star hotel. It's just a place to sleep. If you are catching a plane in the morning and have a rental car, I suggest you head down University to Mills Ave. near the ASU campus--lots of restaurants, stores and people.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: KarenATL
Reviews.Content: Pros: In-room microwave and refrigerator, menus for restaurants that deliver to the hotel, vending machines that dispense hot pizza (not so much a pro, as an impressive feat of food distribution), friendly shuttle drivers (think Cheech and Chong … MAN). Good breakfast, including do-it-yourself waffles, boiled eggs, bagels, cereal, oatmeal, etc. Cons: Postage stamp sized room, shower/toilet enclave door that would not lock, very noisy room. To catch the airport shuttle from the airport, you can only leave a phone message. The message fails to tell you that regardless of where you are, you must make your way to the blue diamond at the north terminal pick-up location to catch the shuttle (a fact that we did not learn until we called the front desk after waiting 30 minutes in the south terminal). Aside from the vending machines, the Sleep Inn does not have on-site food services. Instead, walk across the street to the Hilton and enjoy free hors d'oeuvres during happy hour (5-7pm) at the on-site sports bar. Then, walk through the bar to the restaurant and indulge yourself on a reasonably priced dessert. Bottom line: If you need to spend the night in Phoenix while you wait for your flight home the next day, one night at the Sleep Inn will not kill you.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fine”
Reviews.Author: DanandTan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sleep Inn on the 15th May. We wanted somewhere to stay when we arrived in Phoenix at night before picking up a car the next day. First the not so good news. We rang up for the Shuttle Bus when we got to the airport and were told it would be 20 minutes. We waited for 40 and it didnt arrive, we rang again and were told it was on its way. We waited another 20 and it still didnt arrive. In the end we just got a taxi. The good news was that when we got to the hotel which is about 5 minutes away we got an immediate no questions asked refund for the taxi and apologies. They really dont seem that well set up shuttle bus wise. When we got it in the morning it was a plain van, all the other hotels had buses with their logos plastered all over. (on another note the bus only goes on the half hour so book early and be prepared that you may not get the slot you want) The room was fine, good size, comfy bed and it had a microwave and a Fridge. The vending machines had loads of microwave meals and similar stuff which was very handy for one night. All in all the room did exactly what we wanted and had a very convinient location, if they can sort the shuttle out it will be really good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: FrankSmeeks
Reviews.Content: This is a good place for the money to stay near the airport. There is a lot of construction around Sky Harbor so it is a little tricky with the black letters on white signs to see where to turn and they are set back a little from the road. So if you get turned around you can be hunting a while. We finally found this hotel, and while we were hunting we called and honestly I let the phone ring until it times out each time with "your party is not answering". Well I think it should be embarassing to any hotel chain when a customer is in line in your lobby to check in, finally gets up, is holding the cell phone in their hand and has to ask the clerk why he is not answering the phone and you have been standing there calling the hotel to see if anyone ever answers. I asked him if he knew what that sound was... The next morning at checkout, the response from the daytime manager was "he was probably out smoking when you tried to call for directions", the only problem was there was another woman there who they claimed was a trainee, apparently they had not gotten so far as to the phone. I would have likely knocked $20 off my bill for the frustration; but if you don't have to, then you don't have to. The Hilton across the way has a very nice lounge (none at the SLepp Inn) and my burger was good as well. The rooms were nice, clean, quiet and comfortable, now if they could hire staff for the hotel you'd be all set!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in total. The first on our arrival in Phoenix prior to our driving tour round and were so impressed we reserved a room for the nights prior to flying back out of Phoenix to Holland. Everything was clean, the staff were unbelievably friendly and helpful - from giving us milk at 2am to help us sleep as we were jet lagged to arranging the shuttle bus to take us to Mills avenue so we could go for a night on the town!! Having toured round for two weeks the amenities and service here were not beaten along our travels - high speed internet, breakfast, pool, spa, vending machines, fridge, microwave. Would definitely recommend!!

HotelInfo.Name: Sleep Inn Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 2621 S. 47th Pl., Phoenix, AZ 85034
